item.title: Tools Toward Sublimity
item.description: Looking at the way that the Self, Nature and the Sublime are framed in Romantic-era science, it is intriguing to see how (even in fields supposedly untinged by subjectivity), the medium conveys and marinades the message. It is difficult to imagine any scientist today, for instance, voicing the lines from William Herschel:1 This method of viewing the heavens seems to throw them into a new kind of light.
